channel.title: The Porch (Video)
channel.description: Welcome to the sermon podcast of The Porch, a young adult ministry of Watermark Community Church in Dallas, Texas. The Porch is a gathering of 3,000+ young adults who meet every Tuesday night at 7 PM CST. Each week we address challenges that face twenty and thirty-somethings and what The Bible has to say about them. For more information, visit www.theporch.live or download The Porch app: https://apple.co/2MlYc1P.
channel.itunes:author: The Porch

item.title: When God Feels Unfair | Kylen Perry
item.description: It's easy to play the comparison game and wonder why God gives to others what you wanted for yourself, but have you ever considered what fairness actually looks like in your life? This week, Kylen Perry walks us through the story of Cain and Abel in Genesis 4 to remind us that God doesn't give us what we deserve — and that's actually the best-case scenario.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: How to Be a Good Listener | Trip Lee
item.description: If you listen to God and it doesn't compel you to act on His Word, you didn't really hear what He was saying. So how do we become good listeners? This week, rapper, author, pastor, and our guest speaker Trip Lee walks us through James 1:19-25 to show us what Scripture has to say about the matter.
item.itunes:author: Trip Lee

item.title: Where Do We Go Wrong? | Kylen Perry
item.description: How do things go so wrong so quickly? We saw the fall of humanity in Genesis 3 with Adam and Eve, and we see our own failures play out daily. This week, Kylen Perry walks us through the original sin and shows us how we often repeat similar patterns and how God always remains faithful in the midst of our brokenness.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: What You Were Made to Do | Kylen Perry
item.description: What do you want more of this year? Whether we acknowledge it or not, our issue doesn't usually start with a lack of wanting; it's what we use to satisfy that desire. This week, Kylen Perry leads us through Genesis 2 to show what God had in mind as He carefully crafted and commissioned humanity.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: How God Creates & Cares | Kylen Perry
item.description: From the first verse of the Bible, we see that God is the Creator, but He is not a distant, bored deity. As we look at the weaving structure and intentionality with which He creates, His deep care is on full display. This week, Kylen Perry walks us through Genesis 1 to highlight these truths of God's character and how they impact us today.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Gratitude for the Angry | Kylen Perry
item.description: Anger as an emotion is not the issue; how we process that emotion is where the issue lies. So how do we do that? This week, Kylen Perry finishes out the "20/20" series by walking us through Psalm 37 to show how the solution to anger isn't "be happy," it's to engage in gratitude.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Self-Forgetfulness for the Insecure | Kylen Perry
item.description: Are you so plagued by insecurity that it feels hard to see straight sometimes? While the problem of self-hate has grown rampant, Kylen Perry leads us through Psalm 139 to remind us that by seeing God rightly, we will have a clearer picture of who we really are.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Get Your Hopes Up | Grant Partrick
item.description: Many of us guard our hearts from potential disappointment by lowering our expectations and living with little to no hope. But what if we got our hopes up? This week, guest speaker and Teaching Pastor at Passion City Church in Atlanta, Grant Partrick, walks us through Romans 15 to remind us of the abundant hope God offers.
item.itunes:author: Grant Partrick

item.title: Self-Control for the Addicted | Kylen Perry
item.description: Behavioral addiction doesn't just suddenly show up in our lives; it gradually creeps in without even registering on our radar. This week, Kylen Perry leads us through Psalm 141's wisdom of pursuing self-control over indulgence even when it feels so out of our reach.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Peace for the Anxious | Tyler Moffett
item.description: Emotions like fear and anxiety aren't inherently bad — they're warning lights that point to something else. But when those little alarms start going off in your head all the time, that's when they move from being a tool to an issue. This week, Tyler Moffett teaches from Psalm 46 to remind us that God is our refuge and strength so we don't always have to be on the defense.
item.itunes:author: Tyler Moffett

item.title: Hope for The Depressed | Kylen Perry
item.description: We often find ourselves grappling with emotions and situations that leave us feeling out of depth. Some of us lead with our heads, while others are controlled by our hearts — but all of us need to find a healthier, gospel-centered way of navigating through our depression.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Standing Firm in a Secular World | Tyler Moffett
item.description: Many have sought the world's promises and turned up empty-handed, and while outright opposition to Christianity has slowly transitioned into curiosity, we as the Church don't have the luxury of sitting back. As Tyler Moffet walks us through 2 Timothy 3:10-4:8, we're reminded that we can't settle for fitting into a secular world — we're called to become consecrated followers of Jesus no matter the cost.
item.itunes:author: Tyler Moffett

item.title: The Dangers of False Teaching | Kylen Perry
item.description: In a world where it's easy to find someone with a comfortable opinion rather than facing hard truths, it's more important than ever to identify and flee from any voice that contradicts Scripture. This week, Kylen Perry walks us through 2 Timothy 3:1-9 to remind us not only to skillfully avoid the dangers of false teachers, but also to closely follow the Way, the Truth, and the Life.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: How to Live With Honor | Kylen Perry
item.description: You can’t control when a crisis comes, but you can control your composure when it does. This week, Kylen Perry walks us through 2 Timothy 2:14-26 to show us how God instructs us to live honorably in a dishonoring day.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: The End is Near | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: A lot of predictions about the end times have been swirling around, and while no man knows the time or day of Jesus' return, Scripture instructs us to live as if the end is near — because it is. This week, Timothy "TA" Ateek walks us through 1 Peter 4:1-11 to show us how to live with urgency as believers.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: The Way to Strength | Tyler Moffett
item.description: When Christians begin to look and respond like everyone else, it's worth asking, "Where have the strong people gone?" This week, Tyler Moffett leads us through 2 Timothy 2:1-13 to show us what Paul describes as the way to godly strength.
item.itunes:author: Tyler Moffett

item.title: The Calling On Your Life | Kylen Perry
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Who God Says He Is | Matt Chandler
item.description: We have to stop trying to create God in our own image — and we have to believe Him when He tells us who He is. This week, guest speaker and Lead Pastor of The Village Church, Matt Chandler, breaks down Exodus 13:14-15 to remind us that we have a holy God who is so much better than anything we could come up with.
item.itunes:author: Matt Chandler

item.title: What If I'm Just Not Attracted to Them? | Kylen Perry
item.description: How much does chemistry matter? Whether sparks are flying or feelings are falling flat in your relationship, the Bible actually has a lot to say about the types of love, and the answer might surprise you. This week, Kylen Perry walks us through Scripture to show us God's design for the way we feel and express love.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: How Do I Break Up With Someone? | Kylen Perry
item.description: What do you do when it's time to call it quits? This week, Kylen Perry gives us a biblical framework for breaking up with grace. While the Bible doesn’t give us a detailed blueprint on how to break up with our significant other, it goes into great detail on how to treat one another in all circumstances.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: How Far is Too Far? | Kylen Perry
item.description: It's time to rethink how we view boundaries; it's not about how far we can go, it's about viewing God as too good to get near the line. This week, Kylen Perry walks us through 1 Thessalonians 4 to remind us of God's heart to protect us through emotional, physical, and spiritual boundaries.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: "How Do I Know if They're The One?" | Ben Stuart
item.description: Dating is a process you move through, not a status you sit in — so how do you move toward the next step with wisdom? This week, Ben Stuart, pastor of Passion City Church in Washington, D.C., walks us through Genesis 24 to show us how seriously God takes marriage and whom to pursue for a lifelong commitment.
item.itunes:author: Ben Stuart

item.title: Why Does This Keep Happening to Me?
item.description: Do you find yourself burned by toxic relationships, unending lust, accidental situationships, and disapproval from those who are supposed to be in your corner? This week, Tyler Moffett points to the story of Peter in Luke 22, and we see that the Lord is not scared of our broken past, but instead He is calling us into a future of freedom.

item.title: Is Dating Supposed to be This Hard? Pt. 2 | Kylen Perry
item.description: So many of us have found dating to be less blissful than we hoped and more painful than we expected. And there’s a good reason for that: dynamics have changed, advice from so-called "experts" varies, and the world is more confusing than ever. This week, we want to make dating a little easier with some biblical truths that should change the way we navigate romantic relationships.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Is Dating Supposed to be This Hard? Pt.1 | Kylen Perry
item.description: While we all want to skip the stress and hack our way to happily ever after, you've probably been left wondering, "Is dating supposed to be this hard?" This week, Kylen Perry leads us through Scriptures that show us how to build relationships that last based on the picture given to us by the One who loved us first.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Why Am I Still Single? | Kylen Perry
item.description: Are you sick of people telling you singleness is a gift? While the Bible supports the idea that singleness is not a season of life to endure, but a season of life to embrace, we know that doesn't mean it's without its challenges. This week, Kylen Perry walks through different reasons why healthy relationships can feel so far out of reach sometimes.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Will I Ever Find Love? | Kylen Perry
item.description: We all want to find love, but a lot of us don't know where to look. This week, as we kick off our "We Need to Talk" series, Kylen Perry leads us through Genesis 2 to remind us we don't need to be married to experience connection, fulfillment, and intimacy — it's all available to us in Christ right now.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Who Jesus is to You | Dave Bruskas
item.description: Jesus is the One who gives the world around us meaning and significance — so what we believe to be true about Him matters. This week, guest speaker and executive director of discipleship, Dave Bruskas, leads us through Colossians 1 to remind us that Jesus is not just a representation of God, but God Himself, and that should change everything for us.
item.itunes:author: Dave Bruskas

item.title: The Point of My Christianity | Kylen Perry
item.description: We can't settle for a cheap version of Christianity that in no way compares with the price Christ was willing to pay for us. This week, Kylen Perry leads us through Exodus 33 to show us that if Jesus made a way for us to be with God, we have to prioritize seeking His presence.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Purpose When it Feels Pointless | Tyler Moffett
item.description: Almost all frustration stems from unfulfilled expectations, but how do we react when faced with disappointment? This week, Tyler Moffett reminds us through 1 Kings 19 that zeal for the Lord does not imply a shallow pursuit when everything is going smoothly, but rather an energetic and unwavering commitment to God, even in times of trial.
item.itunes:author: Tyler Moffett

item.title: Set Apart for Something More | Kylen Perry
item.description: Do you need to escape the comfort culture? In the Christian life, there are times when we voluntarily take on considerable costs for a considerable purpose.This week, Kylen Perry leads us through 2 Timothy 2 to remind us that a consecrated life is one that is uncommonly devoted.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Real Repentance | Kylen Perry
item.description: Is your repentance genuine? This week, Kylen Perry walks through 2 Corinthians 7 and challenges us to think through the difference between godly grief and worldly grief. There is no real repentance without a dramatic removal of our sin and that all starts with a brokenness over it.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: A Conversation on Sexuality | Brenna Blain
item.description: A conversation usually marked by division and shame is brought to the stage as we welcomed author and modern theologian, Brenna Blain, along with Kylen Perry and Timothy "TA" Ateek, to discuss what it looks like to have a Biblical perspective on our sexuality.
item.itunes:author: Brenna Blain

item.title: The Level of Your Longing | Kylen Perry
item.description: What do you want more than the Lord? This week, Kylen Perry leads us through Isaiah 55 to remind us that pursuing anything less than the Lord will always leave us wanting more.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: The First Step to Revival | Kylen Perry
item.description: As a quiet revival ripples across this generation, we have to ask — are we seeing the same change happen in our own spiritual lives? This week, Kylen Perry walks us through Hosea 10:12 to show us that before we ask for widespread revival we have to experience an inner renewal.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Do You Feel Loved? | Kylen Perry
item.description: Is it hard for you to believe God loves you? Are you living like He loves you? This week, Kylen Perry walks through Ephesians 3 to show us Paul's passionate plea for us to not just know God loves us, but for us to experience it.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Hidden Sin & Stolen Joy | Kylen Perry
item.description: You can't be the happiest version of yourself without God — so what is separating us from the happiness He provides? This week, Kylen Perry point to Psalm 32 to show us that through confession, honest sinners can have the happiest lives.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Joy When You're Hurting | Tyler Moffett
item.description: You are not disqualified from joy because of your suffering. This week, Tyler Moffett, our new Director of Discipleship, reminds us through James 1 that God can use the most broken circumstances to bring about even greater joy.
item.itunes:author: Tyler Moffett

item.title: The Solution You Need | Trip Lee
item.description: Where do you turn to in a time of need? This week, guest speaker Trip Lee walks us through John 6:1-15 to remind us the size of our problems doesn’t change the source of our help.
item.itunes:author: Trip Lee

item.title: Rediscovering Your Joy | Kylen Perry
item.description: In our world, joy seems to be a lost art — so where do we find it? This week, Kylen Perry leads us through the book of Philippians, where God gives us a roadmap to a life of excitement, joy, wonder, and delight.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: A Life Lacking Joy | Kylen Perry
item.description: God wants more for your life than occasional optimism. He wants you to have and experience true joy, because He that's who He innately is. This week, we kick off our aptly named "Joy" series as Kylen Perry points to a variety of Scriptures that all lead to one conclusion — the Joy you’ve been looking for came looking for you.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: How to Deal With Other People's Success | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: Has your jealousy turned everyone around you into the competition? This week, our lead pastor and elder, Timothy "TA" Ateek, leads us through 1 Samuel 18 to show us how different people dealt with the future king David's success, and what it means for us to celebrate the success of those in our lives who seem to turn everything they touch to gold.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: "If That's Who God is, I Don't Want Him" | Kylen Perry
item.description: How do we pick up and put back the pieces when we're suffering — and how do we reconcile that God allowed it to happen? This week, as we close out our "Deconstructed" series, Kylen Perry walks us through John 16 to remind us that God has made us a way through our suffering now and will one day remove it forever.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: "I'm Disappointed With Jesus" | Kylen Perry
item.description: Two things can be true: Life can be hard and God can be good. This week, this idea is unpacked as Kylen Perry points to Matthew 11 to show us how God meets us in moments of disappointment and reminds us of His truth when we come to a crisis in our faith.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: "I Don't Know What's True" | Kylen Perry
item.description: Rather than conforming our lives to the truth, we often try to conform the truth to fit our lives. This week, Kylen Perry walks us through John 18 as we see Jesus answer the question "What is truth?" — a question many of us might be asking ourselves.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: "I've Been Hurt By the Church" Pt. 2 | Kylen Perry
item.description: Has your church experience felt like a bait and switch? As Kylen Perry picks back up in Matthew 23, we can be encouraged that no matter how big an issue we have with religious hypocrisy, Jesus has a bigger one — and that He has come to heal the hurt in His church.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Your Story Has A Villain | Jonathan Pokluda
item.description: What do you think of when you hear "spiritual warfare?" While it might seem like science fiction, the reality is that it's all around us — and we have to be prepared as believers. This week, guest speaker and Lead pastor of Harris Creek Baptist Church, Jonathan "JP" Pokluda, leads us through Ephesians 6 as he reminds us that in the face of danger, we have to take up the Armor of God.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Pokluda

item.title: "I've Been Hurt by The Church" Pt. 1 | Kylen Perry
item.description: Sometimes what makes us doubt God's goodness is the lack of goodness we've seen in His people. So how do we overcome our hurt when it was caused by friendly fire? This week, Kylen Perry takes us through Matthew 23 to show how Jesus dealt with religious figures who leveraged their authority against the people Christ came to save.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: "I Have More Doubt Than Faith" | Kylen Perry
item.description: What happens when you have doubts? This week, as we kick off our "Deconstructed" series, Kylen Perry walks us through Luke 24 to remind us that God doesn't want to build in us an unbreakable belief as much as He wants to build an unbreakable bond — and that through every doubt, we have an opportunity to love God more.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Navigating the New | Kylen Perry
item.description: The Porch Returns this week to talk about what it means to depend on the Lord while navigating the new. Our Director, Kylen Perry, points to Numbers 13-14 to remind us of key truths from Scripture that should mark our decision-making and actions as believers.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Unto Us A Child is Born | Kylen Perry
item.description: Have you lost your wonder for the Christmas season? For our "Christmas At The Porch" message, Kylen Perry reminded us of Philippians 2:6-11, where we're told we can have peace, joy, and hope in every season because Jesus reigns over all.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: What Jesus Cares About | Kylen Perry
item.description: Too often, we view salvation as essential and discipleship as optional — but in Scripture, we see that it's impossible to find Jesus and not follow Him. This week, Kylen Perry takes us to Matthew 28 to remind us of our God-given purpose and role in the Great Commission.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Losing Your Love | Kylen Perry
item.description: Have we grown disenchanted in our discipleship to Jesus? This week, Kylen Perry takes us to Revelation 2 to remind us that if we've lost our love for Jesus it may be time to be reacquainted with our Savior.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: The Mystery of Christ | Drew Worsham
item.description: Believers are told we have the unmatched gift of Christ in us — so why do we act so underwhelmed by the God of the universe making His home in our hearts? This week, guest speaker Drew Worsham takes us through Colossians 1:24-29 to remind us of the mystery and majesty of our relationship with the Lord of our lives.
item.itunes:author: Drew Worsham

item.title: Faith or Fear | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: When we lack control in a situation it's easy to feel fearful, stressed, and overwhelmed. This week, our Lead Pastor and Elder Timothy "TA" Ateek points to Mark 4:35-41 to remind us that when we cast our cares upon the Prince of Peace, we can choose faith over fear.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Running From God | Brenna Blain
item.description: It may feel impossible to believe that after all the times we’ve hidden from, avoided, and ran from God, He would still be faithful to pursue us— but that's exactly what Scripture says to be true. This week, our guest speaker, Brenna Blain, describes how the Lord used the book of Hosea in her own story and reminds us that God is faithful even when we are not.
item.itunes:author: Brenna Blain

item.title: A Walk On The Waves | Kylen Perry
item.description: So many of us want a life of deep meaning and to be connected to something that truly matters — and the Bible tells us that God wants those things for us too. This week, Kylen Perry takes us to Matthew 14:22-33 to show us that we find this not just by knowing of Jesus, but by becoming more like Him.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Shepherd of the Black Sheep | Kylen Perry
item.description: Being a disciple of Jesus means we must seek His people — but who are His people? This week, Kylen Perry points to Luke 8:26-39 to show us that Jesus has always sought to give dignity to the defiled and extend salvation to those we may deem too far gone.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: How Do I Love God? | Kylen Perry
item.description: What did Jesus say is the greatest commandment? To love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind. But how do we actually do that? This week, Kylen Perry walks us through Matthew 22:34-40 and gives us practical ways to live out what is most important.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: The Offer on The Table | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: Jesus has extended us the ultimate invitation — one where we can lay down our burdens and enjoy true rest in relationship with Him. This week, our Lead Pastor Timothy "TA" Ateek points to Matthew 11:28-30 to remind us that we shouldn't settle for anything less than full satisfaction through our Savior.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: The Choice that Changes Everything | Kylen Perry
item.description: How do we respond when Jesus says, "Follow Me"? What does it even mean to follow him? This week, Kylen Perry dives into Luke 5:1-11 to show us the response we ought to have when we encounter Jesus. Following Jesus has a cost but nothing is worth keeping if it keeps us from Jesus.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: God of The Nobodies | Kylen Perry
item.description: How should we think about ourselves as children of God? True significance isn’t found in who you are; it’s found in who God is. This week, Kylen Perry refers to the story of Moses and the burning bush in Exodus 3 to remind us that we won't feel worthy until God enters our story.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Not Called to Be Safe | Nate Hilgenkamp
item.description: Do we look for the path of least resistance when God is calling us to follow the path that leads to Him? This week, our guest speaker Nate Hilgenkamp, young adults and teaching pastor of Harris Creek Baptist Church, takes us to 2 Samuel 15 & 18 to remind us that God doesn’t promise easy, instead He’s given us a Kingdom purpose in enemy territory.
item.itunes:author: Nate Hilgenkamp

item.title: The Dream Job Complex | Kylen Perry, Caitlin Van Wagoner, and John Cox
item.description: This week, we welcomed John Cox, Watermark's executive pastor, and Caitlin Van Wagoner, Watermark's senior communications director, on stage with Kylen Perry to share Biblical truths and practical wisdom they've learned over the course of their careers.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry, Caitlin Van Wagoner, and John Cox

item.title: 5 Lessons in 5 Years | Josiah Jones
item.description: Following Jesus isn't a solo sport, and we're called to pass the baton of faith on to those around us. But how do we do this well? This week, Josiah Jones walks through Hebrews 12 to show us lessons he's learned from Scripture and a life of ministry on how to live out the mission we've been called to.
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: The Way We Work | Kylen Perry
item.description: We often want to find our purpose in our work, but God has already filled our jobs with purpose. This week, Kylen Perry refers to Ephesians 6 to show us that we've been instructed in how to work well in a world that wants us to work with an agenda.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: The Road Back From Betrayal | Kylen Perry
item.description: The ideas of revenge and bitterness aren’t exactly new, but the Bible and the world have very different opinions on how we should deal with the sting of betrayal. This week, Kylen Perry points to Genesis 37-50, where Joseph is betrayed by everyone around him - including his own brothers - yet God uses what some meant for evil for the good of a nation.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Family of Outsiders | Oren Martin
item.description: The Bible uses a lot of “family” language, but what does it mean that we’re a part of God’s family? This week, Oren Martin, Watermark’s Senior Director of Equipping, points to Mark 3:20-35 to show us how Jesus is making a new family of God on earth gathered around Himself — and he’s doing it with outsiders.
item.itunes:author: Oren Martin

item.title: The Marriage Talk | Kylen & Brooke Perry
item.description: How we relate to Jesus says a lot about how we'll relate to our spouse. This week, Kylen Perry and his wife, Brooke, walk us through the misconceptions of marriage and what scripture says marriage is - and isn't - truly about.
item.itunes:author: Brooke Perry and Kylen Perry

item.title: What They're Looking For in You | Kylen Perry
item.description: We spend a lot of time seeing if other people measure up to our ideal dating checklist — but have we stopped to evaluate ourselves first? This week, Kylen Perry points to 1 Timothy 4:12 and other passages to remind us that a meaningful connection to God is the source of a meaningful connection to others.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Theology of Friendship | Kylen Perry
item.description: Why do we have friends — and more importantly how do we become good ones? As we kick off "The Relationship Series," Kylen Perry points to 1 Samuel 18 to show us the theology of friendship and how we can deepen the relationships that God gave us for our enjoyment.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Conviction to Action | Kylen Perry
item.description: The more we look to Jesus, the more we become like Him — and that means living like we believe we have a mission here on earth, because we do. This week, Kylen Perry points to Colossians 4:2-6 to remind us that as we gain clarity of Christ, we should start to pray, walk, and speak differently than we did before.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Moment of Surrender | Tyler Moffett
item.description: What if you believe in God, but just don’t feel Him right now? This week, guest speaker Tyler Moffett, points us to Isaiah 49 as we consider what it means to navigate trials and suffering while trusting in God’s promises — and it all starts with a moment of surrender.
item.itunes:author: Tyler Moffett

item.title: Freedom from Pornography | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: The world has repackaged the shackles of pornography as the symbol of sexual freedom — so how do we move forward? This week, Timothy "TA" Ateek points to Colossians 3:5 to remind us that we're called to put all sexual immorality - whether it's videos, books, thoughts - to death and live in the freedom that Christ offers.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Putting On Christ | Kylen Perry
item.description: If we're made new when we accept Christ, why do we try to keep the old? This week, Kylen Perry walks us through Colossians 3:1-17 to remind us that we're called to set our sin aside and set our minds on Christ instead.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Spiritual Fraud | Kylen Perry
item.description: Are you trying to add to Jesus? This week, Kylen Perry walks us through Colossians 2:16-23 to show us that we don't have to chase spiritual feelings, seek moral activities, or give an impressive appearance — our love of Christ is what makes us more like Him.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Behavior of a Believer | Kylen Perry
item.description: Who - or what - is lord of your life? If you claim Jesus Christ, then there has to be a total life transformation that follows. This week, Kylen Perry walks us through Colossians 2 to give us a few lessons for the living we see Paul outline for the church of Colossae.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Clarity of Christ | Kylen Perry
item.description: Who is Jesus really? Is he a miracle worker? Religious figure? The guy my parents believe in? Or is He something more altogether? This week, Kylen Perry walks us through Colossians 1:15-20 to provide clarity on who Jesus actually is. Speaker: Kylen Perry
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: From Orphan to Heir | Drew Worsham
item.description: While we were once slaves to our sin, Jesus came to make a way for us to live as sons and daughters of our Heavenly Father — so why do we still act like orphans? This week, guest speaker Drew Worsham walks us through the parable of the prodigal son in Luke 15 to remind us that we're not defined by our rebellion, but by our reconciliation to the Father.
item.itunes:author: Drew Worsham

item.title: Signs of Life | Kylen Perry
item.description: The point of a Christian life is to know God and live for Him — how can we tell if we're actually doing this, though? As Kylen Perry reminds us through Colossians 1 - where Paul is reminding the believers in Colossae - when we walk with the Lord, our very identity changes and we should show some signs of new life.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Reality of Our Reputations | Kylen Perry
item.description: What are you known for? This week we kicked off our new series "Above All," and Kylen Perry takes us through Colossians 1 to show us what it means to have a genuine faith that leaves a lasting impression.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: The Purpose of Purity | Jonathan "J.P." Pokluda
item.description: We’re called to be holy and set apart from the world in all areas of life. This week, guest speaker and Lead Pastor of Harris Creek Baptist Church Jonathan “J.P.” Pokluda reminded us through 1 Thessalonians 4 that when we act on sexual desires outside of God’s design we end up in places we never meant to go.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Pokluda

item.title: The One Thing to Know | Kylen Perry
item.description: Do you want Jesus to be Lord over all your life, or just part of it? This week, Kylen Perry walks us through John 9 to show us that Jesus will meet us where we are, but He isn't just concerned with healing the areas of our lives we decide need fixing, He wants to make everything new.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: The One Thing to Do | Josiah Jones
item.description: What are you putting your confidence in? Whether it’s your literal resume or your spiritual one, when we treat Jesus like a sidenote in the story we come up empty-handed. This week, Josiah Jones takes us through Philippians 3 to remind us we don’t need to perform for Christ, we just need to pursue Him.
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: Giving up Perfection | Kylen Perry
item.description: All of life is a drawing close or a drifting away from God — but what makes the difference? This week, Kylen Perry points to 1 John 1 and makes the case that confessing our sin and accepting the gift of forgiveness is the key to closeness to Christ.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: The One Thing You Need | Kylen Perry
item.description: Are you addicted to being busy? Finding satisfaction in an ever-growing to-do list? While it's easy to slip into achiever mode, this week Kylen Perry takes us through Luke 10 to show us that when we live distracted we risk missing out on the one thing we really need — to focus fully on Jesus.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: One Thing You Lack | Kylen Perry
item.description: Surrender by nature is uncomfortable, yet it's what God instructs us to do daily. When a rich young ruler in Mark 10 is told this it leads to disappointment, but this week Kylen Perry reminds us that the cost of following Jesus is nothing compared to what we get in return.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: The One Thing to Ask | Kylen Perry
item.description: It's easy to get distracted in a world that demands our attention. This week, Kylen Perry walks us through Psalm 27, where we see David recognize that in order to pursue what matters, we have to give our attention to the One who deserves our focus — and it all starts with one question.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Untangle Your Emotions | Jennie Allen
item.description: Do you try to "fix" your feelings? Guest speaker and author of "Untangle Your Emotions" Jennie Allen walks us through John 11 to remind us that Jesus felt things deeply, and when we learn how to acknowledge our feelings in a biblical way we can find freedom from the confusion.
item.itunes:author: Jennie Allen

item.title: Gospel Identity/Self-Acceptance | Nate Hilgenkamp
item.description: We're constantly being told we need to find ourselves, but what if we just need to rest in the identity God's already given us? This week, guest speaker Nate Hilgenkamp walks us through 1 Peter 1 to remind us that names are given, not earned — and God has called us chosen.
item.itunes:author: Nate Hilgenkamp

item.title: Contentment/Self-fulfillment | Kylen Perry
item.description: Where are you looking to find fulfillment? Answers probably range from jobs and status to relationships and looks, but in this message, Kylen Perry teaches from Psalm 27 to show us that true contentment is found when we rest in dependence on our Father.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Self-Surrender/Self-Sufficiency | Kylen Perry
item.description: Do you trust God to be the Lord of your life — or is that a title you want to keep for yourself? Last night, Kylen Perry walked us through Matthew 6 to remind us that God doesn’t want us to strive to achieve self-sufficiency, but rest in the confidence that comes with self-surrender.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: For God So Loved The World | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: Why do we celebrate Christmas? This week, Timothy “TA” Ateek reminds us of the truth behind John 3:16, the most famous verse in the Bible, to show us that the good news of the season is rooted in the reality of the Gospel.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: The God Who Listens | Kylen Perry
item.description: Do you feel like your expectations of God doesn't match your experience of Him? This week, Kylen Perry walks us through Philippians 4:6-7 and the relationship between intimacy with God and prayer. Our prayer life will lead us to the peace of God that surpasses all understanding if we submit and confess our anxious thoughts to Him.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Jesus The Restorer | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: Do you ever wish you could hit the reset button on past mistakes? This week, Timothy “TA” Ateek walks us through Peter’s redemption story in John 21 to remind us that the past doesn’t have the right to remind us of our failures, only of our restoration in Jesus Christ.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Enough is Enough | Louie Giglio
item.description: How would your life change if you knew you had everything you needed with Jesus? This week, guest speaker Louie Giglio, Pastor of Passion City Church and Founder of Passion Conferences, walks us through the life of Paul in Acts and his writings in Romans and 2 Corinthians to remind us that we have the authority under Christ to conquer sin and live convinced that we can accomplish the works God has appointed us to do.
item.itunes:author: Louie Giglio

item.title: Jesus The Servant | Josiah Jones
item.description: In His last hours, Jesus didn’t flex His power or showcase His status — instead, He lowered Himself down to serve those who knew Him the be the Messiah. This week, Josiah Jones walked us through John 13:1-15 to show us that true greatness is found when we serve others and love those around us even when it means humbling ourselves.
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: Jesus The Healer | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: Is there sin or sickness in your life that needs healing? It's not hard to see this world is broken and in need of healing, but how do we move from hurting to healed? This week, Timothy "TA" Ateek walks us through John 5:1-15 and shows us we need more than healing for our brokenness — we need the right view of the Healer.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Jesus The Truth | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: What does it mean to have a saving faith? For Nicodemus, it meant following all the rules and checking the boxes, but this week Timothy “TA” Ateek walks us through John 3:1-15 to show us how Jesus is the Truth Teller when it comes to our salvation — it’s not something we earn, but a free gift we’re miraculously given!
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Jesus The Living Temple | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: You’ve probably heard “The church isn’t a place, it’s a people,” but do we actually live our lives like the Holy Spirit lives within us? This week, Timothy “TA” Ateek walks us through John 2:13-22 and shows us how God cares deeply for His temple, and sometimes that means clearing out distractions and sacrificing convenience so we can prioritize the Presence of God.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: God and Suffering | Matt Chandler
item.description: Suffering is (unfortunately) inevitable, but it’s not the end — instead of temporary happiness, God offers us eternal joy when we look to Him during trials. This week, guest speaker Matt Chandler, Lead Pastor of The Village Church, walks us through the Book of Job to remind us that even though we live in a broken world, God draws close to the brokenhearted.
item.itunes:author: Matt Chandler

item.title: Jesus the Disciple Maker | Josiah Jones
item.description: Believing in Jesus is the beginning of your faith journey, not the end. Now it's time to follow Him, but how do we do that in a culture that pushes being in control of your own life? This week, Josiah Jones walks us through John 1:35-51 to show us how we can be better disciples of the one true leader of our lives.
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: Jesus The Word | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: In the beginning was the Word, then the Word became flesh and we were given the ultimate gift. This week, Timothy "TA" Ateek walks us through John 1:1-14 to show us how to respond to the gift of Jesus, the Son of God who came to reveal His Glory.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Hunger for Holiness | Luke LeFevre
item.description: If we want a revival to happen in our generation, we have to have a hunger for holiness — but what does that look like? Guest speaker Luke LeFevre walks us through Matthew 24:37-44 to remind us that God's patience with us is not His passivity toward our sin, and if we want to experience true intimacy with Him we have to repent and start pursuing holiness.
item.itunes:author: Luke LeFevre

item.title: Wrestling With Your Identity | Kylen Perry
item.description: In a society where we're told to "live our truth," Scripture makes it clear that the only way to find our identity is to recognize who we are in Christ. This week, guest speaker Kylen Perry, Metro Venue Pastor in Houston, TX, walks us through Genesis 32:24-30 to show us how God will lead us out of hiding to get us to embrace our design.
item.itunes:author: Kylen Perry

item.title: Do Future You a Favor | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: How will your future self look back on your young adult years? This week, Timothy "TA" Ateek walks us through the wisdom of Ecclesiastes 11-12 and gives us biblical guidelines for living in a way that honors God and keeps us from wasting our 20s and 30s.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Get an Eternal Perspective | Josiah Jones
item.description: When you have an eternal perspective, the way you live your life should change. This week, Josiah Jones takes us through Ecclesiastes 7 and highlights Biblical truths that will help us live in the present, with the end in mind.
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: How to Avoid Unnecessary Pain | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: As Christians, the Bible tells us trials are inevitable — but what if you're putting yourself through additional, avoidable pain? This week, Timothy "TA" Ateek takes us through Ecclesiastes 10 and lays out what the Bible says about seeking wisdom to keep us off a path that leads to hurt.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Where is Your Treasure? | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: Money is on our minds, but it shouldn't rule our hearts. This week, Timothy "TA" Ateek walks us through Ecclesiastes 5:10-6:6 to show us that money can bring joy and contentment or stress and anxiety; it all depends on whether you view money as a gift or a god.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: The Truth of The Trinity | Oren Martin
item.description: How can you love someone you don’t know? To love God, we must know who He is—the one God who is three persons: God the Father, God the Son, and God the Holy Spirit. This week, guest speaker Oren Martin walks us through Ephesians 1:3-14 to give us a biblical perspective of the Triune God who is worthy of our praise.
item.itunes:author: Oren Martin

item.title: Worthy of Our Worship | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: Do you ever feel like your worship has become stale? Unfulfilling? Or maybe you feel that worship simply isn’t for you. As we continue in our series, Dust to Dust, TA walks us through Ecclesiastes 5 to show us five keys to true worship that is life giving and satisfying in your walk with the Lord.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Who Are Your People? | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: God’s design for the Christian life is to be lived in and amongst community. His people are there to lift us up in times of trouble, rejoice in times of celebration, and pray in times of desperation. Simply said: life is better together!
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: The Beauty of God | Josiah Jones
item.description: What your life isn’t as beautiful as you want it to be? How would your outlook on life change? As we continue our series over the book of Ecclesiastes, we see not only that there is a time for everything but that God makes everything beautiful in His time.
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: Nothing New Under the Sun | Tommy Nelson
item.description: There is nothing is us that can give us meaning. Have you ever thought about that? As we kick off our new series ‘Dust to Dust’ through the book of Ecclesiastes, Tommy Nelson, Senior Pastor and Elder at Denton Bible Church, walks us through chapters 1 and 2 to see and consider the futility of life without God.
item.itunes:author: Tommy Nelson

item.title: Find Your Life | Jennie Allen
item.description: Have you ever considered what it means to surrender? Or are you unsure of how to surrender? Jennie Allen, founder of IF:Gathering and member at Watermark Community Church, shows us in Matthew 6:27 and Galatians 2:20 what it means to fully surrender to God’s perfect and freeing plan for our daily lives.
item.itunes:author: Jennie Allen

item.title: Stuck in Sin | John Elmore
item.description: Are you feeling stuck? Needing someone to help pick you up when you’re down? John Elmore, a Teaching Pastor at Watermark Community Church, reminds us that Jesus is the better way, the best truth, and the eternal life.
item.itunes:author: John Elmore

item.title: The Fight | Ben Stuart
item.description: Guest speaker Ben Stuart, from Passion City DC joined us last night to help us see how to fight temptation in the Christian life. Looking at James 1:14-18, we see that though we have an enemy that wants to destroy us, God’s love is infinitely bigger for each of you.
item.itunes:author: Ben Stuart

item.title: Becoming a Praying Church | Timothy "TA" Ateek and Jennie Allen
item.description: As we conclude the Prayer series, our friend and Watermark member, Jennie Allen, is back with TA to give us a glimpse into the apostles’ prayer life through the book of Acts and how we can mimic their prayers today.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek and Jennie Allen

item.title: How to Pray Pt. 2 | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: Feeling stuck, discouraged, or stale in your prayer life? As we continue in our prayer series, TA walks us through a variety of ways to pray so that we may experience greater intimacy with God through our prayer life.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: How To Pray | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: As we continue our Prayer series, we are stepping into Jesus’ the Sermon on the Mount in Matthew 6. From Jesus’ own teaching we will see that we have instruction how to pray and what prayer does for our relationship with the Lord.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: A Conversation on Prayer | Timothy "TA" Ateek and Jennie Allen
item.description: Prayer changes everything. What if you began to believe that God actually wants to hear from you? In this message, we sit down with our friend Jennie Allen and have a conversation on prayer. We learn and are reminded of the intimacy we get to experience with God when we bring everything to Him through prayer.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek and Jennie Allen

item.title: Please Don't End Your Life | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: In 2021, suicide was the second leading cause of death for people between 20 and 34. If you feel like life is painful, uncomfortable, and unbearable, then this message is for you. You are loved. There is hope. Please don't end your life. You can text or call anything to "988" to speak with someone immediately.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: God Favors You | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: In this message, we close out the Psalm 23 series by talking about the favor of God. Why is this important? Because many of us are exhausted from chasing favor. We look at Psalm 23:6 to learn that favor is actually chasing us.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: How to Win at Life | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: When you think about following Jesus, which word feels more familiar to you? Victory or failure? If it's failure, then the good news is that Psalm 23 gives us three keys to walking in Christ’s victory. Victory means change is possible. You can take ground against sin. You can grow in Christlikeness. Why? Because Jesus has already won.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: How to Survive Hard Times | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: How do we navigate the times when the realities of our life seem so different than our dreams? In this message, we look at Psalm 23:4 to see three things we may need to change in order for us to spiritually make it through hard times.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Truly Satisfying | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: In this message, we look at Psalm 23:2-3 and find that our good Shepherd is the only one who can truly satisfy the longings of our souls, heal what is broken, and lead us on a path that leads to joy and flourishing.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: The Lord Is My Shepherd | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: What does David mean when he refers to God as Shepherd? He is inviting us to see God as the leader, owner, provider, protector, and physician. The good news is that God’s identity as Shepherd brings peace to our reality and clarity to our activity. Put simply: who he is, changes how we live.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Gray Areas of Christianity | Josiah Jones
item.description: The Bible is black and white on some topics, but there are many things that are not directly addressed, so they have gray areas. In this message, we look at 1 Corinthians and list four questions to answer when you're facing gray area topics.
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: How Do I Protect My Heart? | Jonathan Pokluda
item.description: In this message, Jonathan "JP" Pokluda walks us through Proverbs 4:20-27 and poses five questions to help us learn how to better protect our hearts.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Pokluda

item.title: You're Not God | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: We have a tendency to either want to be God or replace God. We want to be in control of our own lives and call all the shots. In this message, TA walks us through Isaiah 2 and reminds us that all along there has only been one God. What are you consciously or subconsciously exalting? What gets your greatest allegiance, adoration, affection, and obsession?
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: The Thing That's Killing You | John Elmore
item.description: What if the very thing holding you back and killing you from the inside out isn’t because of anything you’ve actually done? In this message, we talk about the one thing that can change every relationship you have.
item.itunes:author: John Elmore

item.title: How to Share Your Faith | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: Every single one of us has a crucial role to play in reaching those who do not know Jesus. But maybe you're not sure how to start and need some direction. In this message, Timothy "TA" Ateek walks through 2 Corinthians 5:16 and clarifies five things …mentality, message, mission, motivation, and method when it comes to caring about those who don’t know Jesus.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: It's Time to Be Real | Josiah Jones
item.description: Are you ever hit with a wave of loneliness? Are you ever at a social event surrounded by many so-called friends and feel like no one there truly knows you? Maybe the reason for this is that you are not doing community the way God intended. You were created to be fully known and fully loved. It's time to start being real.
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: The First Step to Freedom | John Elmore
item.description: Everyone's got something they hate but keep going back to...porn, body image issues, control, alcohol, drugs, pride, anger, social media, etc. If you knew Jesus was coming back this year, would you want to finally get free from your sin?
item.itunes:author: John Elmore

item.title: Is Jesus Coming Back Soon? | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: If you knew Jesus was coming back soon, what would change? In this message, we look at Revelation 1 to gain the right perspective that will cultivate the right response to Jesus whether he comes back tomorrow or a year from now.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: 6 Qualities to Look for in a Husband | David Marvin
item.description: In this message, David Marvin walks us through 1 Timothy 3 to unpack 6 qualities to look for in a husband. Men, these are the qualities you should aim to have. Ladies, use these 6 areas to examine a man before committing to marrying him.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: 6 Qualities to Look for in a Wife | Jonathan Pokluda
item.description: Oftentimes, guys start the search for a wife with "how do they make me feel", instead of "will they be good at the assignment?" In this message, Jonathan "JP" Pokluda walks us through Proverbs 31 and points out 6 qualities to look for in a wife.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Pokluda

item.title: Six Questions to Save Your Marriage Before It Begins | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: 80-90% of young adults hope to get married. No one dreams of a mediocre marriage. No one envisions being married and longing for the days of being single again. In this message, we ask six questions worth answering to save your marriage before it even begins.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: 10 Keys to Uncomplicated Dating | David Marvin
item.description: If you're in a "complicated" relationship or have always felt like your dating life is too complicated, this message is for you. God didn't intend for our relationships to be complicated. So, let's uncomplicate things. In this message, we reveal 10 keys to uncomplicated dating to have a healthy, God-honoring, and life-giving relationship.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Three Signs You're Not Ready to Date | David Marvin
item.description: In this message, we uncover three key signs that you're not ready to date.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: How Do I Win the War Against Me? | David Marvin
item.description: There is an invisible world that is impacting the visible world you see. War is happening all around you right now - war for your heart, soul, purity, marriage, job, etc. So, how do you win the war against you?
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Who Are You? | Mickey Friedrich
item.description: Do you ever face conflicted realities such as what you feel vs what you SHOULD feel? In this message, we walk through Ephesians 5 with special guest Mickey Friedrich and learn three truths about conflicting realities and who we actually are.
item.itunes:author: Mickey Friedrich

item.title: Introducing the New You | David Marvin
item.description: The Apostle Paul wrote the book of Ephesians to teach us how to live a renewed life in Christ. In this message, we continue in Ephesians 4 to learn how to walk in our new identity in Christ, transform our minds, and create new practices.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Walk This Way | David Marvin
item.description: In this message, we take a look at Ephesians 4 and learn three keys to walking through life as a believer.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Next Level | Louie Giglio
item.description: In this message, guest speaker Louie Giglio from Passion City Church shares about how to take your walk with God to the next level.
item.itunes:author: Louie Giglio

item.title: Reach the Unreached | David Platt
item.description: We were created for so much more than this. In this message, we hear from special guest David Platt on the importance of reaching the unreached.
item.itunes:author: David Platt

item.title: What changes everything? | Josiah Jones
item.description: Just as the invention of the iPhone drastically changed the world, this message from Ephesians 2 has the power to change everything about us. In this message, we learn who we were, what Christ has done, and who we are now. So, what changes everything?
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: Who, What, When, Where, Why? | David Marvin
item.description: In this message, we walk through the first chapter of Ephesians to understand who we are, what we need the most, when we will change, where we will spend eternity, and why it all matters.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: What kind of faith do you have? | David Marvin
item.description: Before we fully dive into the book of Ephesians, we must first provide some context and background on the city of Ephesus and the beginning of the church of Ephesus.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Pursuing Greatness | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: In our flesh, our tendency is to be great in the eyes of people. But what a miss it would be to be great in the eyes of the world but not in the eyes of Jesus. In this message, we look at the life of John the Baptist to learn what true greatness looks like.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Is the Bible sexist? | David Marvin
item.description: In this message, we answer a question that is a debated topic in culture today - is the Bible sexist?
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Can a Christian lose their salvation? | JD Rodgers
item.description: Have you ever wondered if a Christian can lose their salvation? Maybe you follow God, but still hook up. Maybe you "left the faith" and wonder if you can still get to heaven. In this message, we define what a Christian is and answer if a Christian can somehow lose their salvation.
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: Can I be LGBTQIA+ and follow Jesus? | David Marvin
item.description: In this message, we answer one of the most frequently asked questions, can I be LGBTQIA+ and follow Jesus? We look at what the Bible says about LGBTQIA+ relationships and discuss how to love LGBTQIA+ people as Jesus does.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Can I mess up God's will for my life? | David Marvin
item.description: Have you ever wished you could shake a magic ball to know exactly what God has for your future? Have you ever been confused about what God's will is for your life or wondered if you could mess up that plan by making the wrong decision?
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Prescription for Stress | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: If you've ever felt stressed out, overwhelmed, or out of control, this is for you. In this message, we look at four key truths about dealing with stress from the scriptures. We learn that stress isn’t inevitable it is optional.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: Prescription for Insecurity | JD Rodgers
item.description: We all have insecurities, but many of us don’t realize how much they impact our lives. In this message, we look at 1 Samuel 17 and talk about what it means to not suppress our insecurities, but rather address them.
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: Prescription for Conflict | David Marvin
item.description: Remember all the things you learned in school that you never used again? In this message, we discuss one subject that was never taught but is a crucial skill to succeeding in life - conflict resolution. Learn about 2 essential things you need to know to resolve conflict in a healthy way.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: How to Forgive | David Marvin
item.description: Last week, we talked through reasons WHY you should forgive that person who wronged you. In this message, we talk through three practical steps to forgiving someone. Find freedom from past hurts, bitterness, anger, and resentment.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Why You Should Forgive Them | David Marvin
item.description: Is there anyone's name that brings anger or bitterness to mind? What about someone you avoid in public because of something that happened or someone you are waiting on to apologize? In this message, we read Matthew 18 and talk through 3 reasons you should forgive that someone.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Battling Sexual Sin | JD Rodgers
item.description: One of the biggest lies the world tells us is that sexual freedom and exploration come at no cost. It’s no question that sexual sin is one of the greatest grips on young adults’ lives today. In this message, we look at 2 Samuel 11 and discuss five ways to battle sexual sin.
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: POV: You were ashamed, now you're set free | David Marvin
item.description: In this message, we look at John 21 and see the POV of a man who was covered in shame and encountered Jesus.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: POV: You were good, but not good enough | David Marvin
item.description: In this message, we cover John 3 and see the POV of a man named Nicodemus who encountered Jesus. His encounter with Jesus answers the most important question that anyone could ask -- who will go to heaven and how do they get there?
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: POV: You were thirsty but now you're satisfied | Josiah Jones
item.description: Where do you search for fulfillment? Do you look for validation from other people, seek temporary pleasures, or strive for success through what you achieve? In this message, we see the point of view of a thirsty woman who was chasing all the wrong things in life, but encountered Jesus and discovered how to have a life of full satisfaction.
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: POV: You were blind but now you see | JD Rodgers
item.description: Many of us have a clear view of Jesus and still don't truly see Him. In this message, we look at the POV of a man in Mark 10 who was blind, yet saw Jesus clearly.
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: POV: You were rich and now you're richer | David Marvin
item.description: In this message, we look at a moment when Zacchaeus, the wealthiest man in the New Testament, encounters Jesus.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: POV: You were dead and now you're alive | David Marvin
item.description: Do you ever wonder what it was like to be up close and personal with Jesus? In this message, we read Mark 5 and hear about Jesus removing demons and restoring daughters, all from the point of view of three disciples: Peter, James, and John.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Character vs Culture | Josiah Jones
item.description: Your ability to be a solid friend, be a great coworker or boss, build a thriving marriage that is going to last the test of time, and become a good parent all rely on good character. So how do we become a man or woman of good character when the culture around us opposes us and is constantly changing?
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: It's Not About You | David Marvin
item.description: We live in a world that encourages self-love, building success, and having it all. But, what if we told you that it's not all about you? In this message, we walk through Daniel 4 to learn the symptoms, side effects, and solutions for a sin that is at the root of all other sins.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Faith on Fire | JD Rodgers
item.description: The only way to know if your faith is real is by seeing how you respond when you are tested with trials of life. In this message, we read Daniel 3 and learn what it means to have faith on fire. When things heat up and you face fires, will you have blazing faith despite the circumstances and outcomes?
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: God Confidence | David Marvin
item.description: Have you ever doubted that God is fully in control? In this message, we look at Daniel 2 to see how Daniel interprets a dream for a powerful king that ends up predicting history and showing us that God's kingdom is the only kingdom that will last.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Standing Firm | David Marvin
item.description: When you're faced with a moral dilemma, do you stand strong in your beliefs or compromise under pressure? In this message, we learn from Daniel 1 what it looks like to stand firm for your faith.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Why You Run From God | JD Rodgers
item.description: When we have incorrect views of God, they cause us to run from Him. In this message, we unpack Luke 15 and learn who God really is.
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: RIP to Gossip | David Marvin
item.description: We all know gossip is bad from an early age, so why do we still do it? In this message, we look at what the Bible says about gossip and talk through the reasons we gossip, the results of gossip, and the removal of gossip.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: RIP to Loneliness | David Marvin and Jennie Allen
item.description: You're not alone in feeling alone. A 2019 study found that three in five Americans reported being chronically lonely. In this message, we're joined by Jennie Allen to discuss how to find your people and create deeper, long-lasting friendships.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin and Jennie Allen

item.title: RIP to Toxic Dating | David Marvin
item.description: Some of the biggest frustrations, hurts, scars, and shame we carry are from dating the wrong way. In this message, we walk through the story of Samson and Delilah in Judges 16 to learn how to say RIP to toxic dating.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: RIP to the American Dream | David Marvin
item.description: Many of us have been chasing after the American dream: a lot of money, a great job, a big house, a nice car, and a picture-perfect family. In this message, we look at Luke 12 to learn how to say RIP to the American dream and hello to something so much bigger and better - living for eternity.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: RIP to Victim Mentality | JD Rodgers
item.description: Victim mentality may look like constantly blaming others, believing everyone is out to get you, or thinking that bad things always happen to you. In this message, we walk through John 5 and learn three ways to change “victim mentality” to "victor mentality" through a relationship with the King of victory.
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: Dead + Gone | Josiah Jones
item.description: It's time for your chains of achievement, money, broken relationships, comparison, and addictions to be dead and gone. In this message, we learn that Jesus didn't wait for us to clean up our lives to die for us. So, what needs to be dead and gone in your life this year?
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: Unplanned Pregnancy Scandal | David Marvin
item.description: The scandalous stories of sinners in this series have all pointed to Jesus. But, what if we told you the story of Jesus himself is scandalous? In this message, we take a look at Matthew 1 to see how nothing will stop God from playing out the story He has written, even an unplanned pregnancy.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Adultery Scandal | David Marvin
item.description: You would think King David, the man most closely associated with Jesus, was a picture-perfect hero. But, did you know he was involved in a scandal of adultery that destroyed his whole family? In this message, we look at 2 Samuel and see how everyone, even King David, is broken, sinful, and unworthy.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Prostitution Scandal | David Marvin
item.description: A lot of us are labeled. Labeled by our past, things we have done, or who we currently are. But, did you know God runs after people with labels? In this message, David Marvin shares the story from Joshua 2 of a prostitute named Rahab. What are you currently labeled as? Find out how God can rewrite yours.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Sex Scandal | JD Rodgers
item.description: God uses sinful people to accomplish His perfect plan. In this message, JD Rodgers shares one of the most scandalous stories in the Bible from Genesis 38 about Jesus' great great grandparents, Judah and Tamar. Do you like reality TV? Buckle up.
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: Mental Health Q + A | David Marvin, Jonathan Pokluda, and Jennie Allen
item.description: It can be really hard to talk about the topic of mental health, especially in the church, but we believe it’s both helpful and necessary. In this message, David Marvin, Jennie Allen, and Jonathan Pokluda discuss how to battle anxiety and loneliness, and how to deal with social media in a healthy, biblical way.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin, Jonathan Pokluda, and Jennie Allen

item.title: Battling Fear | Louie Giglio
item.description: Anxiety, fear, and depression are real. There is an enemy trying to influence your thoughts and feelings, but God is much more powerful than the darkness. In this message, guest speaker Louie Giglio shares how to keep the enemy from pulling up a seat at your table.
item.itunes:author: Louie Giglio

item.title: Battling Depression | David Marvin
item.description: Depression and suicide are at record highs. Many of us feel stuck in a bubble of darkness, isolation, sadness, and hopelessness. What does the Bible say about this? In this message, we discuss what's true about depression, what the causes are, and how we fight it.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Battling Stress | David Marvin
item.description: We're busy with our jobs, we're not getting enough sleep, and the pace of life feels faster than ever. Why are we so stressed out and what will help us experience God's peace instead? In this message, we cover the sources, side effects, and solutions to stress.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Battling Anxiety | David Marvin
item.description: Statistics show that anxiety levels in young adults are at an all-time high. Why are we so anxious and what can we do about it? In this message, we explore what the Bible defines as anxiety and discuss 5 things Jesus taught on the subject.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Dateable, But Single | Josiah Jones
item.description: Are you dateable, available… and still single? Are you worried about being single forever? In this message, we unpack 3 truths from God’s word about singleness.
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: The Dateables | David Marvin
item.description: The Bible doesn't talk about dating, but it does talk about love, relationships and marriage. So how do you honor the other person when dating? In this message, we give you a "how to" by walking through the nine stages from the ask out to the altar.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Is She Dateable? | JD Rodgers
item.description: So what makes a woman dateable? Looks? Personality? Lifestyle? In this message, we discuss three crucial questions that can help determine if she is dateable before you date her.
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: United in Mission | Garrett Raburn
item.description: What causes a person’s life mission to change from living for themselves to living for something bigger? In this message, we learn from Matthew 9 what it means to be “united in mission” with God.
item.itunes:author: Garrett Raburn

item.title: United in Surrender | Jonathan Pokluda
item.description: What does it mean to be “united in surrender”? In this message, we talk about how we can all be united through surrendering ourselves to God. Maybe the greatest thing you could hear is that you’re not actually following God, and maybe understanding that will help you start following God. We are united when we surrender our sin and our lives to him.
item.itunes:author: Jonathan Pokluda

item.title: United Together | Jennie Allen
item.description: What does it mean to be “united together”? In this message, we talk about how as humans, we were created for connection, and we’re designed to live in community. But at times, we wait on everyone around us to initiate, when we can initiate too. Jesus is a master initiator, and we can look to him to be our example.
item.itunes:author: Jennie Allen

item.title: United in Worship | Jefferson Bethke
item.description: What does it mean to be “united in worship”? In this message, we talk about how we can worship God being aligned with his story, and by understanding what it means to be a human as an image bearer of God. If you’re a human, you have a story. It’s impossible to be a human without a story. We’re all captured by a story, and we can be united in worshipping God when we are captured by his story.
item.itunes:author: Jefferson Bethke

item.title: United in Love | Ben Stuart
item.description: What does it mean to be “united in love”? In this message, we talk about how we can all be united through the love of Christ, even though our lives, our circumstances, and our sin all looks different. But Jesus and his love for us can overcome all differences. The truth is, we’re in a difficult place. But the Bible isn’t about making bad people good, but about making dead people alive.
item.itunes:author: Ben Stuart

item.title: Awaken Panel Discussion featuring Jennie Allen, Jonathan Pokluda and David Marvin | David Marvin, Jennie Allen, Jonathan Pokluda, and JD Rodgers
item.description: We sit down with David Marvin, Jennie Allen, and Jonathan Pokluda to ask them all kinds of questions, ranging from what book they would recommend for us to read, all the way to what advice they would give our generation.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin, Jennie Allen, Jonathan Pokluda, and JD Rodgers

item.title: United in Truth | David Marvin
item.description: What does it mean to be “united in truth”? In this message, we talk about how the Bible isn’t a self-help book, and the Bible isn’t about us. The Bible is about Jesus, and he is the main character from beginning to end. We can be united in truth when we realize that the Bible isn’t about us individually, but it’s about Jesus who unites us all in his love.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Marriage-able feat. Jeff Bethke | Jefferson Bethke
item.description: When it comes to dating, who is going to make you look more like the image of God? What does “made in the image of God” really mean? In this message, we study Genesis 1 to learn what to look for when heading toward marriage.
item.itunes:author: Jefferson Bethke

item.title: Is He Dateable? | JD Rodgers
item.description: What makes a man dateable by God’s standards? We tend to let feelings and culture cloud our decisions when it comes to who we date. So in this message, we’re asking three questions that help us decide if he’s truly dateable or not.
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: Are You Dateable? | David Marvin
item.description: Dating is a path that leads to a promise that leads to a lifelong pursuit. But just because you’re available doesn’t mean that you’re datable. In this message, we go through a checklist of priorities that will tell you if you are in fact, dateable.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: "Depart from Me, I Never Knew You" | JD Rodgers
item.description: Not everyone who claims to be a Christian will be in heaven, because it’s not just about your words. How can we be assured that we know Jesus and he knows us? In this message, we look at Matthew 7 to see what Jesus meant when he said, “Depart from me, I never knew you.”
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: "Ask and You Will Receive" | David Marvin
item.description: When Jesus says, “Ask and you will receive,” is it really that simple? Does it mean we can manifest whatever we want if we believe it enough? In this message, we learn what Jesus actually means by this statement and the significance it has for us.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: "You Must Be Born Again" | Josiah Jones
item.description: Have you ever wondered what we need to do to get to heaven? Are you just going through the motions of religion and faking it? In this message, we look at John 3 to learn what Jesus meant when he said “you must be born again” to enter the kingdom of heaven.
item.itunes:author: Josiah Jones

item.title: "Love Your Enemies" | David Marvin
item.description: I'm sure when you think of your enemies, your first response isn't to love them. Culture may tell you differently, but that's exactly what we are to do as Christians. In this message, we learn what Jesus means when he says, "love your enemies."
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: This Is How We Fight Our Battles | JD Rodgers
item.description: Spiritual warfare is something very real, yet no one really talks about it. Sure we know Jesus wins the war in the end, but what does that mean for the everyday battles we face? In this message, we learn from Ephesians 6:10-18 how we can fight our battles.
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: Good People Don’t Go to Heaven (Forgiven People Do) | David Marvin
item.description: Many of us buy the lie that we’re a good person, but there’s no universally accepted standard of what is good. Can we ever be “good” enough? In this message, we look at Mark 10:17-27 to learn three reasons why good people don’t go to heaven (but forgiven people do).
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Porn Ruins Love (and Your Soul) | Ben Stuart
item.description: Believe it or not, the Bible isn’t prude. But the liberation of sexuality in our culture has led to bondage instead of freedom. In this message, we learn the problems porn creates and the principles God gives us for sex.
item.itunes:author: Ben Stuart

item.title: Sin Is Fun (Until It's Not) | JD Rodgers
item.description: Sin may be fun for a moment, but it always has consequences. Why doesn’t sin stay fun forever? Why is every high followed by a low? In this message, we learn the reality and effects of sin so we can learn to get rid of it before it gets rid of us.
item.itunes:author: JD Rodgers

item.title: Sex Before Marriage Is Amazing (But It's Destructive) | David Marvin
item.description: Saving sex for marriage may seem old fashioned. Society tells you to try before you buy, but sex is dangerous outside of the purpose it was designed for. In this message, we look at 1 Corinthians 6:13-7:4 to learn why sex is amazing but destructive.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: Modest Isn't Hottest (But It's Better) | David Marvin
item.description: When you hear modest is hottest what comes to mind? Here’s our hot take: modest isn’t hottest, but it’s better. In this message, we’re diving into God’s word to learn 3 reasons why.
item.itunes:author: David Marvin

item.title: From Good to Godly | Timothy "TA" Ateek
item.description: It’s possible to be considered good but not godly. Is Jesus the passion of your life or just a part of it? In this message, we look at the life of King David in 2 Samuel to learn the four keys of moving from good to godly.
item.itunes:author: Timothy "TA" Ateek

item.title: How We Wait | Jonathan Pokluda
